text:
He was ill a long time.

Prison life weighed heavily on him.

Raskolnikov: “I can endure the work...”

Raskolnikov: “But the shame? The wounds?”

Sonia: “You’re not alone. I’m here.”

---

Shame and pride clash within him.

Raskolnikov: “Why can’t I blame myself?”

Raskolnikov: “I’m just a victim of fate.”

Raskolnikov: “Is that all I have left?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov's illness stems not from the hardships of prison life, but from his wounded pride and inability to accept his fate.
